pr_title: [BEAM-9670] Fix nullability widening in CoGroup key resolution

timeline.bodyText: Shouldn't we still verify that the schemas have equivalent types without nullability?
timeline.author: TheNeuralBit

replies.bodyText: The merge function itself now verifies this.
replies.author: reuvenlax

replies.bodyText: Ah I see. If there aren't any tests verifying this already could you add one?
replies.author: TheNeuralBit

replies.bodyText: There is a test in CoGroupTest.java that verifies this. Should I add an additional one here?
replies.author: reuvenlax

replies.bodyText: It could be nice to have something in ZetaSQLDialectSpecTest to verify the set operation just in case we break the logic there and not in CoGroup, but I guess it's fine either way
replies.author: TheNeuralBit

timeline.bodyText: Just a general comment: do you think we should add a visitor pattern for this sort of thing?
timeline.author: TheNeuralBit

replies.bodyText: Maybe? I'm not sure visitor per se, as we don't require double dispatch. However we might consider generalizing the recursive tree walk.
replies.author: reuvenlax
